Package com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.util

Class ClientContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.util.ClientContext
  • public class ClientContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that consists of app info, device info, additional service info, and user defined data. 
     
 ClientContext clientContext = new ClientContext(activity);

 Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<String, String>();
 map.put("first_name", "John");
 map.put("last_name", "Doe");
 clientContext.putCustomContext(map);

 clientContext.putServiceContext("mobile_analytics", serviceContext);

 String base64 = clientContext.toBase64String();

      Constructs a new client context.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstallationId

        public static java.lang.String getInstallationId​(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the installation id from shared preferences. A new one will be assigned if not found. The installation id is unique per app installation. This value appears as installation_id in client context object in AWS Lambda.
        Parameters:
        context - context of the app
        Returns:
        the unique installation id per app installation
        See Also:
        The Context Object (Node.js)

      • putCustomContext

        public void putCustomContext​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map)
        Adds additional user defined key-value pairs to the client context under "custom". This method is not thread safe. 
         
 Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<String, String>();
 map.put("first_name", "John");
 map.put("last_name", "Doe");
 clientContext.putCustomContext(map);
        The above code will add a Json object under "custom" as following. 
         {
   "custom": {
     "first_name":"John",
     "last_name":"Doe"
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        map - the custom key-value context map

      • putServiceContext

        public void putServiceContext​(java.lang.String service,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map)
        Sets service context under key "services". This will overwrite the service context of the same service name. This method isn't thread safe. 
         {
   "services": {
     "mobile_analytics": {
       "app_id":"mobile_analytics_app_id"
     }
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        service - service name
        map - the service key-value context map

      • toBase64String

        public java.lang.String toBase64String()
        Serializes the client context into a base64 encoded Json string.
        Returns:
        a based64 encoded Json string
